DataElement.preferredName: Adolescent Lifetime Risk Suicidal Ideation Behavior Classification Questionnaire Assessment Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A juvenile between the onset of puberty and maturity; in the state of development between puberty and maturity._An estimate of cumulative risk calculated over a lifetime._Thinking about ending or making plans to end one's own life._human or animal activity studied in terms of motivation, direction, result, emotion, perception, or etiology._A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics._Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: An estimate of cumulative risk calculated over a lifetime.
Thoughts of taking one's own life.
The actions or reactions of an object or organism, usually in relation to the environment or surrounding world of stimuli.
A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.
